text: Then she said to him, “How can you say, ‘I love you,’ when your heart is not with me? You have toyed with me these three times and have not told me where your great strength is.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came about, when she pressed him daily with her words and urged him, that his soul was annoyed to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he told her all that was in his heart and said to her, “A razor has never come on my head, for I have been a Nazirite to God from my mother’s womb. If I am shaved, then my strength will leave me and I will become weak and be like any other man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Delilah saw that he had told her all that was in his heart, she sent word and called the governors of the Philistines, saying, “Come up once more, for he has told me all that is in his heart.” Then the governors of the Philistines came up to her and brought up the money in their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she made him sleep on her knees, and called for a man and had him shave off the seven locks of his head. Then she began to humble him, and his strength left him.
speaker: Narrator

text: She said, “The Philistines are upon you, Samson!” And he awoke from his sleep and said, “I will go out as at other times and shake myself free.” But he did not know that the Lord had departed from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Philistines seized him and gouged out his eyes; and they brought him down to Gaza and restrained him with bronze chains, and he became a grinder in the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, the hair of his head began to grow again after it was shaved off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now the governors of the Philistines assembled to offer a great sacrifice to Dagon their god, and to celebrate, for they said,
“Our god has handed Samson our enemy over to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the people saw him, they praised their god, for they said,
“Our god has handed our enemy over to us,
Even the destroyer of our country,
Who has killed many of us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: It so happened when they were in high spirits, that they said, “Call for Samson, that he may amuse us.” So they called for Samson from the prison, and he entertained them. And they made him stand between the pillars.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Samson said to the boy who was holding his hand, “Let me feel the pillars on which the house rests, so that I may lean against them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the house was full of men and women, and all the governors of the Philistines were there. And about three thousand men and women were on the roof looking on while Samson was entertaining them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Samson called to the Lord and said, “Lord God, please remember me and please strengthen me just this time, O God, that I may at once take vengeance on the Philistines for my two eyes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Samson grasped the two middle pillars on which the house rested, and braced himself against them, the one with his right hand and the other with his left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Samson said, “Let me die with the Philistines!” And he pushed outwards powerfully, so that the house fell on the governors and all the people who were in it. And the dead whom he killed at his death were more than those whom he killed during his lifetime.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then his brothers and all his father’s household came down and took him, and brought him up and buried him between Zorah and Eshtaol in the tomb of his father Manoah. So he had judged Israel for twenty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a man of the hill country of Ephraim whose name was Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to his mother, “The 1,100 pieces of silver that were taken from you, about which you uttered a curse and also spoke it in my hearing, behold, the silver is with me; I took it.” And his mother said, “Blessed be my son by the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He then returned the 1,100 pieces of silver to his mother, and his mother said, “I wholly consecrate the silver from my hand to the Lord for my son to make a carved image and a cast metal image; so now I will return them to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So when he returned the silver to his mother, his mother took two hundred pieces of silver and gave them to the silversmith, who made them into a carved image and a cast metal image, and they were in the house of Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man Micah had a shrine and he made an ephod and household idols, and consecrated one of his sons, so that he might become his priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days there was no king in Israel; everyone did what was right in his own eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a young man from Bethlehem in Judah, of the family of Judah, who was a Levite; and he was staying there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the man left the city, Bethlehem in Judah, to stay wherever he would find a place; and as he made his journey, he came to the hill country of Ephraim, to the house of Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Micah said to him, “Where do you come from?” And he said to him, “I am a Levite from Bethlehem in Judah, and I am going to stay wherever I may find a place.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Micah then said to him, “Stay with me and be a father and a priest to me, and I will give you ten pieces of silver a year, a supply of clothing, and your sustenance.” So the Levite went in.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levite agreed to live with the man, and the young man became to him like one of his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Micah consecrated the Levite, and the young man became his priest and lived in the house of Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Micah said, “Now I know that the Lord will prosper me, because I have a Levite as a priest.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days there was no king of Israel; and in those days the tribe of the Danites was seeking an inheritance for themselves to live in, for until that day an inheritance had not been allotted to them as a possession among the tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the sons of Dan sent from their family five men out of their whole number, valiant men from Zorah and Eshtaol, to spy out the land and to explore it; and they said to them, “Go, explore the land.” And they came to the hill country of Ephraim, to the house of Micah, and stayed overnight there.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they were near the house of Micah, they recognized the voice of the young man, the Levite; and they turned aside there and said to him, “Who brought you here? And what are you doing in this place? And what do you have here?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Micah has done this and that for me, and he has hired me and I have become his priest.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said to him, “Inquire of God, please, that we may know whether our way on which we are going will be successful.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest said to them, “Go in peace; your way in which you are going has the Lord’s approval.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the five men departed and came to Laish, and saw the people who were in it living in security, in the way of the Sidonians, quiet and unsuspecting; for there was no oppressive ruler humiliating them for anything in the land, and they were far from the Sidonians and had no dealings with anyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came back to their brothers at Zorah and Eshtaol, their brothers said to them, “What do you say?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, “Arise, and let’s go up against them; for we have seen the land, and behold, it is very good. And will you sit still? Do not hesitate to go, to enter, to take possession of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you enter, you will come to an unsuspecting people with a spacious land; for God has handed it over to you, a place where there is no lack of anything that is on the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then from the family of the Danites, from Zorah and from Eshtaol, six hundred men armed with weapons of war set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went up and camped at Kiriath-jearim in Judah. Therefore they called that place Mahaneh-dan to this day; behold, it is west of Kiriath-jearim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they passed from there to the hill country of Ephraim and came to the house of Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the five men who went to spy out the country of Laish said to their kinsmen, “Do you know that there are in these houses an ephod and household idols, and a carved image and a cast metal image? Now then, consider what you should do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they turned aside there and came to the house of the young man, the Levite, to the house of Micah, and asked him how he was doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile, the six hundred men armed with their weapons of war, who were of the sons of Dan, were positioned at the entrance of the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the five men who went to spy out the land went up and entered there; they took the carved image, the ephod, the household idols, and the cast metal image, while the priest was standing at the entrance of the gate with the six hundred men armed with weapons of war.
speaker: Narrator

text: When these men entered Micah’s house and took the carved image, the ephod, household idols, and the cast metal image, the priest said to them, “What are you doing?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said to him, “Be silent, put your hand over your mouth, and go with us, and be to us a father and a priest. Is it better for you to be a priest to the house of one man, or to be priest to a tribe and a family in Israel?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest’s heart was glad, and he took the ephod, the household idols, and the carved image, and went among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they turned and left, and put the children, the livestock, and the valuables in front of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had distanced themselves from Micah’s house, the men who were in the houses near Micah’s house assembled by command and overtook the sons of Dan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they called out to the sons of Dan, who turned around and said to Micah, “What is the matter with you, that you have assembled together?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “You have taken my gods which I made, and the priest, and have gone away; what more do I have? So how can you say to me, ‘What is the matter with you?’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sons of Dan said to him, “Do not let your voice be heard among us, or else fierce men will attack you, and you will lose your life and the lives of your household.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the sons of Dan went on their way; and when Micah saw that they were too strong for him, he turned and went back to his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they took what Micah had made and the priest who had belonged to him, and came to Laish, to a people quiet and unsuspecting, and struck them with the edge of the sword; and they burned the city with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was no one to save them, because it was far from Sidon and they had no dealings with anyone, and it was in the valley which is near Beth-rehob. So they rebuilt the city and lived in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they named the city Dan, after the name of Dan their father who was born to Israel; however, the name of the city was previously Laish.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Dan set up for themselves the carved image; and Jonathan, the son of Gershom, the son of Manasseh, he and his sons were priests to the tribe of the Danites until the day of the captivity of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they set up for themselves Micah’s carved image which he had made, all the time that the house of God was in Shiloh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it came about in those days, when there was no king in Israel, that there was a certain Levite staying in the remote part of the hill country of Ephraim, who took a concubine for himself from Bethlehem in Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: But his concubine found him repugnant, and she left him and went to her father’s house in Bethlehem in Judah, and remained there for a period of four months.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then her husband set out and went after her to speak gently to her in order to bring her back, taking with him his servant and a pair of donkeys. And she brought him into her father’s house, and when the girl’s father saw him, he was glad to meet him.
speaker: Narrator

text: His father-in-law, the girl’s father, prevailed upon him, and he remained with him for three days. So they ate and drank and stayed there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now on the fourth day they got up early in the morning, and he prepared to go; but the girl’s father said to his son-in-law, “Strengthen yourself with a piece of bread, and afterward you may go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So both of them sat down and ate and drank together; and the girl’s father said to the man, “Please be so kind as to spend the night, and let your heart be cheerful.”
speaker: Narrator

text: However, the man got up to go; but his father-in-law urged him, and he spent the night there again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now on the fifth day he got up to go early in the morning, but the girl’s father said, “Please strengthen yourself, and wait until late afternoon”; so both of them ate.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the man got up to go, along with his concubine and servant, his father-in-law, the girl’s father, said to him, “Behold now, the day has drawn to a close; please spend the night. Behold, the day is coming to an end; spend the night here so that your heart may be cheerful. Then tomorrow you may arise early for your journey and go home.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the man was unwilling to spend the night, so he got up and left, and came to a place opposite Jebus (that is, Jerusalem). And with him was a pair of saddled donkeys; his concubine also was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they were near Jebus, the day was almost gone; and the servant said to his master, “Please come, and let’s turn aside into this city of the Jebusites and spend the night in it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: However, his master said to him, “We will not turn aside into a city of foreigners who are not of the sons of Israel; instead, we will go on as far as Gibeah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to his servant, “Come, and let’s approach one of these places; and we will spend the night in Gibeah or Ramah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they passed along and went their way, and the sun set on them near Gibeah which belongs to Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: They turned aside there to enter and spend the night in Gibeah. When they entered, they sat down in the public square of the city, for no one took them into his house to spend the night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then behold, an old man was coming out of the field from his work at evening. Now the man was from the hill country of Ephraim, and he was staying in Gibeah, but the men of the place were Benjaminites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he raised his eyes and saw the traveler in the public square of the city; and the old man said, “Where are you going, and where do you come from?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to him, “We are passing from Bethlehem in Judah to the remote part of the hill country of Ephraim, for I am from there, and I went to Bethlehem in Judah. But I am now going to my house, and no one will take me into his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet there is both straw and feed for our donkeys, and also bread and wine for me, and your female slave, and the young man who is with your servants; there is no lack of anything.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the old man said, “Peace to you. Only let me take care of all your needs; however, do not spend the night in the public square.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he took him into his house and fed the donkeys, and they washed their feet and ate and drank.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were celebrating, behold, the men of the city, certain worthless men, surrounded the house, pushing one another at the door; and they spoke to the owner of the house, the old man, saying, “Bring out the man who entered your house that we may have relations with him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the man, the owner of the house, went out to them and said to them, “No, my brothers, please do not act so wickedly. Since this man has come into my house, do not commit this vile sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Here is my virgin daughter and the man’s concubine. Please let me bring them out, then rape them and do to them whatever you wish. But do not commit this act of vile sin against this man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the men would not listen to him. So the man seized his concubine and brought her outside to them; and they raped her and abused her all night until morning, then let her go at the approach of dawn.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the day began to dawn, the woman came and fell down at the doorway of the man’s house where her master was, until full daylight.
speaker: Narrator

text: When her master got up in the morning and opened the doors of the house and went out to go on his way, then behold, his concubine was lying at the doorway of the house with her hands on the threshold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to her, “Get up and let’s go,” but there was no answer. Then he put her on the donkey; and the man set out and went to his home.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he entered his house, he took a knife and seized his concubine, and cut her in twelve pieces, limb by limb. Then he sent her throughout the territory of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who saw it said, “Nothing like this has ever happened or been seen from the day when the sons of Israel came up from the land of Egypt to this day. Consider it, make a plan, and speak up!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the sons of Israel from Dan to Beersheba, including the land of Gilead, came out, and the congregation assembled as one person to the Lord at Mizpah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the leaders of all the people, all the tribes of Israel, took their stand in the assembly of the people of God, four hundred thousand foot soldiers who drew the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now the sons of Benjamin heard that the sons of Israel had gone up to Mizpah.) And the sons of Israel said, “Tell us, how did this wickedness take place?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Levite, the husband of the woman who was murdered, answered and said, “I came with my concubine to spend the night at Gibeah which belongs to Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the citizens of Gibeah rose up against me and surrounded the house at night, threatening me. They intended to kill me; instead, they raped my concubine so that she died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I took hold of my concubine and cut her in pieces, and sent her throughout the land of Israel’s inheritance; for they have committed an outrageous sin and vile act in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, all you sons of Israel, give your response and advice here.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the people rose up as one person, saying, “Not one of us will go to his tent, nor will any of us go home.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now this is the thing which we will do to Gibeah; we will go up against it by lot.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we will take ten men out of a hundred throughout the tribes of Israel, and a hundred out of a thousand, and a thousand out of ten thousand to supply provisions for the people, so that when they come to Gibeah of Benjamin, they may punish them for all the vile sin that they have committed in Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the men of Israel were gathered against the city, united as one man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the tribes of Israel sent men through the entire tribe of Benjamin, saying, “What is this wickedness that has taken place among you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now then, turn over the men, the worthless men who are in Gibeah, so that we may put them to death and remove this wickedness from Israel.” But the sons of Benjamin would not listen to the voice of their brothers, the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, the sons of Benjamin gathered from the cities to Gibeah, to go out to battle against the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the cities on that day the sons of Benjamin were counted, twenty-six thousand men who drew the sword, besides the inhabitants of Gibeah who were counted, seven hundred choice men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of all these people seven hundred choice men were left-handed; each one could sling a stone at a hair and not miss.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men of Israel besides Benjamin were counted, four hundred thousand men who drew the sword; all of these were men of war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Israel set out, went up to Bethel, and inquired of God and said, “Who shall go up first for us to battle against the sons of Benjamin?” Then the Lord said, “Judah shall go up first.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the sons of Israel got up in the morning and camped against Gibeah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The men of Israel went to battle against Benjamin, and the men of Israel lined up for battle against them at Gibeah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sons of Benjamin came out of Gibeah and struck to the ground on that day twenty-two thousand men of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the people, the men of Israel, showed themselves courageous and lined up for battle again in the place where they had lined themselves up on the first day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Israel went up and wept before the Lord until evening, and inquired of the Lord, saying, “Shall we again advance for battle against the sons of my brother Benjamin?” And the Lord said, “Go up against him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the sons of Israel came against the sons of Benjamin on the second day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Benjamin went out against them from Gibeah the second day and struck to the ground again eighteen thousand men of the sons of Israel; all of these drew the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the sons of Israel and all the people went up and came to Bethel, and they wept and remained there before the Lord, and fasted that day until evening. And they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Israel inquired of the Lord (for the ark of the covenant of God was there in those days,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Phinehas the son of Eleazar, Aaron’s son, stood before it to minister in those days), saying, “Shall I yet again go out to battle against the sons of my brother Benjamin, or shall I stop?” And the Lord said, “Go up, for tomorrow I will hand them over to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Israel set men in ambush around Gibeah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Israel went up against the sons of Benjamin on the third day and lined up against Gibeah as at other times.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the sons of Benjamin went out against the people, they were lured away from the city, and they began to strike and kill some of the people as at other times, on the roads (one of which goes up to Bethel, and the other to Gibeah), and in the field, about thirty men of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Benjamin said, “They are defeated before us, like the first time.” But the sons of Israel said, “Let’s flee, so that we may draw them away from the city to the roads.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the men of Israel rose from their place and lined up at Baal-tamar; and the men of Israel in ambush charged from their place, from Maareh-geba.
speaker: Narrator

text: When ten thousand choice men from all Israel came against Gibeah, the battle became fierce; but Benjamin did not know that disaster was close to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord struck Benjamin before Israel, so that the sons of Israel destroyed 25,100 men of Benjamin that day, all who drew the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the sons of Benjamin saw that they were defeated. When the men of Israel gave ground to Benjamin because they relied on the men in ambush whom they had set against Gibeah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the men in ambush hurried and rushed against Gibeah; the men in ambush also deployed and struck all the city with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the agreed sign between the men of Israel and the men in ambush was that they would make a great cloud of smoke rise from the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men of Israel turned in the battle, and Benjamin began to strike and kill about thirty men of Israel, for they said, “Undoubtedly they are defeated before us, as in the first battle.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the cloud began to rise from the city in a column of smoke, Benjamin looked behind them; and behold, the entire city was going up in smoke to heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men of Israel turned, and the men of Benjamin were terrified; for they saw that disaster was close to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, they turned their backs before the men of Israel to flee in the direction of the wilderness, but the battle overtook them while those who attacked from the cities were annihilating them in the midst of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They surrounded Benjamin, pursued them without rest, and trampled them down opposite Gibeah toward the east.
speaker: Narrator

text: So eighteen thousand men of Benjamin fell; all of these were valiant men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest turned and fled toward the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon, but they caught five thousand of them on the roads and overtook them at Gidom, and killed two thousand of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all those of Benjamin who fell that day were twenty-five thousand men who drew the sword; all of these were valiant men.
speaker: Narrator

text: But six hundred men turned and fled toward the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon; and they remained at the rock of Rimmon for four months.
speaker: Narrator

text: The men of Israel then turned back against the sons of Benjamin and struck them with the edge of the sword, both the entire city with the cattle and all that they found; they also set on fire all the cities which they found.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the men of Israel had sworn in Mizpah, saying, “None of us shall give his daughter to Benjamin in marriage.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people came to Bethel and sat there before God until evening, and raised their voices and wept profusely.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, “Why, Lord, God of Israel, has this happened in Israel, that one tribe is missing today from Israel?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came about the next day that the people got up early and built an altar there, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sons of Israel said, “Who is there among all the tribes of Israel who did not go up to the Lord in the assembly?” For they had taken a solemn oath concerning anyone who did not go up to the Lord at Mizpah, saying, “He shall certainly be put to death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Israel were sorry for their brother Benjamin, and said, “Today one tribe is cut off from Israel!
speaker: Narrator

text: What are we to do for wives for those who are left, since we have sworn by the Lord not to give them any of our daughters as wives?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, “What one is there of the tribes of Israel that did not go up to the Lord at Mizpah?” And behold, no one had come to the camp from Jabesh-gilead to the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when the people were counted, behold, not one of the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead was there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the congregation sent twelve thousand of the valiant warriors there, and commanded them, saying, “Go and strike the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead with the edge of the sword, along with the women and the children.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the thing that you shall do: you shall utterly destroy every male, and every woman who has slept with a male.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they found among the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead four hundred young virgins who had not known a man by sleeping with him; and they brought them to the camp at Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the whole congregation sent word and spoke to the sons of Benjamin who were at the rock of Rimmon, and proclaimed peace to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the tribe of Benjamin returned at that time, and they gave them the women whom they had allowed to live from the women of Jabesh-gilead; but they were not enough for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people were sorry for Benjamin, because the Lord had created a gap in the tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the elders of the congregation said, “What are we to do for wives for those who are left, since the women have been eliminated from Benjamin?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, “There must be an inheritance for the survivors of Benjamin, so that a tribe will not be wiped out from Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we cannot give them wives from our daughters.” For the sons of Israel had sworn, saying, “Cursed is he who gives a wife to Benjamin!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said, “Behold, there is a feast of the Lord from year to year in Shiloh, which is on the north side of Bethel, on the east side of the road that goes up from Bethel to Shechem, and on the south side of Lebonah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they commanded the sons of Benjamin, saying, “Go and lie in wait in the vineyards,
speaker: Narrator

text: and watch; and behold, if the daughters of Shiloh come out to take part in the dances, then you shall come out of the vineyards, and each of you shall seize his wife from the daughters of Shiloh, and go to the land of Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when their fathers or their brothers come to complain to us, we shall say to them, ‘Give them to us voluntarily, because we did not take for each man of Benjamin a wife in battle, nor did you give them to them, otherwise you would now be guilty.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Benjamin did so, and took wives according to their number from those who danced, whom they seized. And they went and returned to their inheritance, and rebuilt the cities and lived in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Israel departed from there at that time, every man to his tribe and family, and each one departed from there to his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days there was no king in Israel; everyone did what was right in his own eyes.
speaker: Narrator
